definition: each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)

pinyin: Xiang1 hu4 Bao3 zheng4 Hui3 mie4
dian4 ci2 xiang1 hu4 zuo4 yong4

sentences.english: Non-codependent love requires wholeness to emerge within.
sentences.chinese: 不再相互依赖的爱，需要从内在出现完整。

sentences.english: The centralization and the decentralization in the old China competed and alternate mutually.
sentences.chinese: 旧中国中央集权与地方分权相互竞争，相互交替。

sentences.english: The centralization and the decentralization in the old China competed and alternate mutually.
sentences.chinese: 旧中国中央集权与地方分权相互竞争，相互交替。

sentences.english: Both labour and management were putting out feelers.
sentences.chinese: 劳资双方相互试探对方。

sentences.english: Term and common words are in an interflow in language use.
sentences.chinese: 我们认为，它们在语言使用过程中相互渗透。

sentences.english: Adds a sequence of connected cubic Bzier curves to the current figure.
sentences.chinese: 在当前图形中添加一系列相互连接的立方贝塞尔曲线。

sentences.english: Consideration can be defined as mutual promises.
sentences.chinese: 双价可定义为相互的承诺。

sentences.english: Methods The four wave interaction model equations for small scale disturbances were analyzed numerically.
sentences.chinese: 方法对小尺度运动四波相互作用模型进行数值分析。

sentences.english: All my brothers are killing each other for the throne.
sentences.chinese: 我的兄弟们为了皇位相互杀戮。

sentences.english: There was more  name-calling in the campaign for senator than I ever heard before.
sentences.chinese: 在那次参议员竞选中相互谩骂之多是我闻所未闻的。

sentences.english: In the holiday between the relatives and friends mutually congratulates , the gift, the expression is mutually friendly.
sentences.chinese: 节日里亲友之间相互祝贺，互赠礼品，表示友好。

sentences.english: Increasingly, however, it is the Chinese who play Africans off against each other.
sentences.chinese: 然而，是中国人越来越多地操纵非洲人之间相互作对。

sentences.english: We shared glances in class and laughed at each other's jokes.
sentences.chinese: 我们在教室相互凝视着，各自嘲笑对方所讲的笑话。

sentences.english: Both Asia and Europe are cradles of human civilizations and have long been associated with each other.
sentences.chinese: 亚洲和欧洲都是人类文明的摇篮，相互交往源远流长。

sentences.english: It is up to the modeling team to establish conventions of model organization and interdependency.
sentences.chinese: 这取决于建模团队建立模型管理和相互依赖的约定。

sentences.english: For a long time, Hong Kong has embraced the Eastern and Western cultures.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，中西方文化在香港相互辉映，相互交融。

definition: to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
tacit understanding/mutual understanding/rapport/connected at a deep level with each other/(of team members) well coordinated/tight
both sides (in contract)/the two opposing sides (in a dispute)
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
counterpart/other person involved/opposite side/other side/receiving party
neither giving way to the other
